tutorial.title: Soccer Team
tutorial.descriptionContent: Use your knowledge of arrays to assemble a team for an online soccer game

executableContent.instructions:
Let's use our knowledge of arrays to assemble a team for an online soccer game.

First, we need goalies for the team.

1. To get started, create a `const` variable named `goalie` set to an array containing the element `"Sam"`.

Let's now display the goalie.

1. Concatenate the string `"Goalie: "` to the variable `goalie` and display the output in the console.

The displayed string should look like :
```
Goalie: Sam
```

hints.title: Hint
hints.content: Use `console.log` to display anything in the text.

executableContent.instructions:
Every team has defenders. Let's start by first creating an array to contain the list of our team's defenders.

1. Create a `const` variable named `defenders` and set its value to an empty array.

files.name: script.js

hints.title: Hint
hints.content: An empty array is created using `[ ]`, with no elements.

executableContent.instructions:
We need four players in the defender position. 

1. Add `"Lisa"`, `"Tom"`, `"Jenny"`, and `"Jo"` to the `defenders` array.

files.name: script.js

hints.title: Hint
hints.content: Remember, arrays are enclosed in `[ ]` and each value is surrounded by quotes and separated by a comma.

executableContent.instructions:
Now that we have set the defenders, let's also display them in the console.

1. Display `"Defenders: "`, followed by the players in a defender position.

files.name: script.js

executableContent.instructions:
Next up, the midfielders!

1. Create a `const` variable named `midfielders` set to an array containing `"Jim"`, `"Kai"`, `"Ian"`, and `"Ava"`.

files.name: script.js

executableContent.instructions:
Let's now display all the midfielders in the console.

1. Display `"Midfielders: "`, followed by the players in a midfielder position.

files.name: script.js

executableContent.instructions:
The only players left to add are the forwards.

1. Create a `const` variable named `forwards` and set it to an array containing `"Kim"` and `"Lucas"`. 
2. Display `"Forwards: "`, followed by the players in a forward position, in the console.

files.name: script.js
